title: Windows Events Challenge 1
instructions:
After noticing abnormal behavior on a Windows workstation, you have been provided with the challenge.evtx Security Event log file to analyze as part of an incident response investigation. Your task is to examine the log file and answer specific questions to understand the extent and nature of the security incident.

Challenge File:

  • 03_Endpoint_Security/Windows/Challenges/challenge.evtx

questions.question: What is the hostname of the computer that generated the logs in the challenge.evtx file?
questions.hint: If you're using the Event Viewer, look for the Computer field.

questions.question: What is the Process ID (PID) of the execution process that cleared the security event log?
questions.hint: Open up the releated log based on its specific Event ID. Then, look for the Execution ProcessID field.

questions.question: How many logon events are recorded in the logs?
In chronological order, list the names of the accounts that were created within the logs.
Which user account was disabled according to the event logs?
Which user account was deleted according to the event logs?
In chronological order, list the security-enabled local groups that the backdoor user account was added to.
questions.hint: There may be cases where the system can't resolve the MemberName field. However, you can still correlate a user account's unique Security Identifier (SID) from the user creation event.

questions.question: Which user account was added to the Backup Operators group?
questions.hint: There may be cases where the system can't resolve the MemberName field. However, you can still correlate a user account's unique Security Identifier (SID) from the user creation event.
